comments:
Here is my configuration:
BIRT Runtime Version: 2.1.1.
Tomcat-Version: Apache Tomcat/5.0.25
JVM Version: 1.4.2_02-b03

I did what the tutorial told and copied the birt.war into my webapps/ folder in Tomcat.
After starting the Tomcat the war file was extracted and I could launch the example application from:

http://localhost:8080/birt/

But when I clicked on "View Example" I got an Exception:



    070102-15:52:18 INFO [org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina] Server startup in 5728 ms

    at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.invoke(ContainerBase.java:929)
    at org.apache.coyote.tomcat5.CoyoteAdapter.service(CoyoteAdapter.java:160)
    at org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Processor.process(Http11Processor.java:793)
    at org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol$Http11ConnectionHandler.processConnection(Http11Protocol.java:702)
    at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.TcpWorkerThread.runIt(PoolTcpEndpoint.java:571)
    at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.ThreadPool$ControlRunnable.run(ThreadPool.java:644)
    at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:534)



After not beeing successful on google I had a closer look to the stacktrace an found the following line:

    Unable to find config file. Creating new servlet engine config file: /WEB-INF/\services\server-config.wsdd




I had a look in the birt/WEB-INF/ directory. There was no folder called "services" but the file server-config.wsdd was under WEB-INF.

So I tried to create the folder "services" in WEB-INF manually, copied server-config.wsdd to this dir,  restarted the Tomcat and the Example suddenly worked.

Conclusion:
I did the following:

1. Create the folder YOUR_TOMCAT_PATH/webapps/birt/WEB-INF/services manually
2. Copy the the file server-config.wsdd from YOUR_TOMCAT_PATH/webapps/birt/WEB-INF/ to YOUR_TOMCAT_PATH/webapps/birt/WEB-INF/services/
3. restart Tomcat and run the example Report again.

Sorry, I can't reproduce this issue following your steps.We also never met this error when deployed BIRT on other web servers( JBoss,Weblogic,Websphere....).
"/WEB-INF/server-config.wsdd" is the default location for axis to lookup the server client config file. So we can't move this file into "/WEB-INF/services" folder, it will cause many more issues.
Anyway, it is a very special case associted with your env.. Please considering it. Thanks.
